name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
description:
Dear Airbnb Searchers,
In this unsettled time we welcome guests to our home. FOR NOW we are limiting the number of guests to a MAX OF TWO. Contact me if your group is larger than that. We offer self check-in and out and we adhere strictly to social distancing and mask protocols.

Please wear a MASK as you enter and exit the house.

Activities available in the area that are described below reflect times BEFORE the current health concerns. PLEASE check for openings or closings.

The space
I understand that you may have concerns about staying in someone else's home, either emotionally or logistically.  I want to assure all of you that our home will be a safe space for you to enjoy.  The 2nd floor bedroom and bathroom are completely private.   They are thoroughly cleaned and disinfected between each visit. Cleaning and disinfectant products will also be available for your use.  
The front entrance is shared by me, m
neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the right as you stand in front of our house. There is a convenient coffee and breakfast place just a block away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's and Taqueria, three of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, WORD bookstore, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: I am a costume designer and seamstress.  I am married to Tom, a retired architect. We have two daughters who live in Washington D.C. and Brooklyn.  My stepson is an artist who lives in Bali.

name: Charming 3BR Apt, Only 20 Minutes to Time Square!
description:
A Large Spacious 3 BR Apt in a beautiful House! Each room has a Queen bed. Cots or Air Mattresses available for large groups.

One parking spot on the driveway is reserved for this unit.

Steps from a bus to Time Square in 20 minutes. Or Uber to or from Manhattan for $35 in 15 minutes.

Equipped with wireless internet, cable TV, washer/dryer, full kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, kettle, coffee maker.

If you need help, you can always text or message me. I live near by in NYC!

The space
Brand new furniture and everything you need to make your stay comfortable.

There's cable TV (make sure to turn on the cable box) and high speed internet.

There's also a smart end table, where you can plug your phone and play some music.

Washer/Dryer too!

Guest access
Just Apt #3. The unit is on the 3rd floor (up two flights of stairs).

There is a drive way with
neighborhood_overview:
I don't know the immediate neighborhood that well as I'm from Manhattan.

For food, for those without cars, seamless.com or postmates.com is convenient. You can use postmates.com for grocery deliveries too.

If you're desperate there is a 24 hour mini convenience store at the gas station a block away from the apt. Just walk to Kennedy blvd. Jaritza (1085 Summit ave) is a small supermarket within walking distance.

For local transportation, Uber or Lyft is great. Or the bus at Kennedy Blvd right in front of the gas station (catch that to Manhattan in 20-30 min) for $3.25.

Hoboken and Grove Street are very fun spots if you don't feel like making a trip to Manhattan. A cheap Uber or car ride away if you have your own car.

Use Google Maps for directions (download the offline maps if you don't have internet).
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Hi, I'm Sterling.  I am a native New Yorker, and love NYC!   I enjoy a variety of activities including comedy, sports, and music.   These activities keep me pretty busy especially in the evenings - if you're interested in checking out a free amateur improv comedy show, please let me know and you'll get to see me perform too.   

My ideal guest is outgoing, independent, and communicates well via text or e-mail.  I also prefer a guest that is positive and flexible.  I do my best to provide a very clean, warm environment, but things won't always be perfect.  

Also, keep in mind, this is NYC, a very expensive place, so depending on where you're from, you might be surprised that the price doesn't get you nearly as far as your hometown and the noise level will be likely on average noisier (this note is mainly for those staying in the NYC location.  The Jersey City location should be comparatively more spacious and more quiet).

Please don't hesitate to reach out if I can do anything to make your stay more comfortable.  I will do my best.   I look forward to hosting you!   

Sterling

neighborhood_overview:
Walk 5 minutes to Central Ave, which has a variety of restaurants and shops.

For food, for those without cars, seamless.com or postmates.com is convenient. You can use postmates.com for grocery deliveries too.

If you're desperate there is a 24 hour mini convenience store at the gas station a block away from the apt. Just walk to Kennedy blvd.

Jaritza (1085 Summit ave) is a small supermarket within walking distance. There are a variety of other small delis within a couple of blocks.

For local transportation, Uber or Lyft is great.
Or the #51 bus at Kennedy Blvd right in front of the gas station (catch that to Manhattan in 20-30 min) for $3.25 which comes by every 5-10 minutes (very often!). Or the NJ transit bus for $4.50.

Hoboken and Grove Street are very fun spots if you don't feel like making a trip to Manhattan. A cheap Uber or car ride away if you have your own car.

name: Apt 2 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC
description:
You'll be staying on the 2nd floor of a 19th-century townhouse in downtown Jersey City. The house is one block from the Newark Avenue pedestrian plaza, with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. There's an ice cream shop (Torico) across the street. It's a five-minute walk to the Grove Street PATH station, where you can get the train to New York City or Hoboken. Door-to-door time to downtown NYC is about 20 minutes.

Jersey City Short-Term Rental Permit #STR20-00061

The space
The house was built in 1887 and is one of five identical houses at this end of the block. It was converted into a 3-family at some point, probably 1970s or 1980s. This apartment is the second floor. The third floor is a separate Airbnb apartment, look for "Apt 3 in downtown Jersey City home near NYC."

Other things to note
Many would-be guests have sent us inquiries, only to have someone else book the dates they wanted before we could even respond. We offer
neighborhood_overview: Our house is right in the middle of downtown Jersey City, one block from the Newark Ave pedestrian plaza, a two-block section of the street that closed to traffic. There are many shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. If you are willing to walk a few more blocks you can reach ShopRite and Newport Mall. Hamilton Park is a 10-minute walk to the north, and to the south is Liberty Park and Liberty Science Center. The neighborhood is safe, and there are usually a lot of people around, so you won’t be alone.

neighborhood_overview: Considered the 6th borough of New York City, this place is the closest you can be to downtown New York City in a neighborhood that legally allows vacation rentals and home-sharing. It is right across the Hudson River from Manhattan with frequent PATH metro service (every 5-10 minutes) to and from World Trade Center, Financial District, 911 Memorial, and midtown Manhattan. It has a bustling local food scene with cuisines from around the world. The neighborhood is safe and friendly. Skyscrapers dot the coastline that overlook the New York City skyline right across the Hudson River.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I love to travel, explore, discover new things, and meet new people.  I'm energetic and optimistic.  I love all types of food from Mexican to French, and everything in between.  I enjoy a nice bottle of wine, preferably full-bodied red.  More than anything, aside from family and friends, I love water.  I've been to the beaches of Cabo, Cancun, Puerto Rico, Hawaii, and Thailand (and California, Florida, and New York, of course), but I can't get enough of white, powder sand beneath my feet, warm ocean breezes blowing gently across my face, and perfectly warm ocean water embracing me.

I am clean, well-mannered, and respectful of others' property and belongings as a guest, treating their home like my own, and expect my guests to treat my place the same.

name: Peaceful, Modern, Private, Clean Apartment!
description:
Private, modern, clean one-bedroom apartment with private front entrance and access to backyard garden.

The apartment is in a cozy + quiet residential area, with groceries & cafes nearby. Convenient to Manhattan: Journal Square PATH station is a 20 minute walk (or 5 minute bike ride or 10 minute local bus ride) away. The PATH gets you into downtown Manhattan in 11 minutes, to the West Village in 20 minutes, to Midtown in 27 minutes. Street parking is available on a first-come basis.

The space
The apartment is a newly renovated single-floor one-bedroom apartment with new finishes, new appliances, bright lighting and outfitted with modern, new furniture. There is access to the private backyard for some fresh air, cigarette break, or to enjoy a morning coffee while you plan your day. To access the outdoors you must pass through our utility room/shop, where my husband may be working from time to time, and which we ask for guests to be mindful when passin
neighborhood_overview:
As former NYC-dwellers, we love how quiet and convenient the McGinley Square neighborhood of Jersey City is compared to Manhattan or Brooklyn! Around the corner from our home is a fantastic coffee shop, Snapdragon, and across from them is a great bike repair shop. There is a wonderful jazz club (Moore's) up the street. Walking around the adjacent neighborhood you come across gorgeous brick homes built form the 1800's onward. Liberty State Park and Lincoln Park are both nearby for biking, jogging, and relaxing.

Lucky Farmer’s Market has great inexpensive produce so you can prepare meals at home. Exito grocery nearby is an inexpensive shop for produce and other needs.

Jersey City historic district is one subway stop over (or 5-minute drive or uber/lyft) at the Grove Street stop, and has many fantastic restaurants.

If your goal is to visit NYC, there is abundant public transportation options to get you there quickly. Extremely accessible to Newark Airp

neighborhood_overview:
This apartment building is located adjacent to Harsimus Cove Light Rail Station, one block from Newport Centre Mall, and steps from the Newport Path. Guests can enjoy local entertainment and delicious eatery from the local shops and restaurants located within walking distance.
This location is one of the most walkable neighborhoods in Jersey City; not only for business but also leisure travelers. Jersey City is a hub of industry with its oil refineries, warehouses, and plants. Although known for its industrial prowess, Jersey City’s gem is Liberty State Park, which offers impeccable views of Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty, and Ellis Island.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

Major highways are easily accessible for day trips to the Jersey Shore, Poconos in Pennsylvania and Hudson Valley in New York.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are just a short 4-min walk to the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

The space

neighborhood_overview:
The Art House is located in the heart of the Historic Powerhouse Arts District. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

name: Cheerful Renovated Basement Apartment by the Park
description:
Bright and newly-renovated basement apartment in our home, with private entrance. Explore NYC (30 mins. away) and then escape afterwards to a quiet house by the park. Kitchen, private bathroom, study area w/ desk, and laundry.

The apartment can sleep 4 but we recommend 3 max. Bedroom has a queen-sized bed and a lounge area with TV w/ Netflix & cable. Entryway has a twin day-bed with a trundle for 2 more guests.

We are committed to the anti-COVID cleaning standards. We live on-site if needed!

The space
We note that although the apartment CAN sleep 4, it might not be the best set up for everyone. There is only 1 bedroom with a queen bed (for 2 guests), and the second bed is a twin with a twin trundle (for the 2 additional guests) in the entryway of the apartment. Great for families with kids, but maybe not ideal for 2 adult couples.

We have bikes to borrow, or there is also a Citibike station within walking distance. The park has g
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Hi - We’re a small family who splits our time between living in Jersey City and NYC. Burak is a journalist from Istanbul. Sarah is a lawyer who has lived in/around NYC for 11 years. We have two sons (born in July 2018 and January 2020), 2 cats, and a small dog. (The animals live in our Jersey City home but we don't allow them in the guest areas.)

Let us know if you have any questions! We look forward to helping you explore the city and nearby areas.

name: NYC hideaway in Jersey City
description:
Convenient beautiful apartment will be your home base during your NYC holiday. Two private bedrooms with a wonderful open layout kitchen, dining and living room. There is a short walk to the NYC bound train and you are in midtown NYC in 20-30 minutes!! The PATH subway is a short walk from the apartment. The neighborhood has a grocery store, American style diner, Indian and Halal food. Also, an urban shopping strip with a nice selection of affordable clothes shopping.

The space
The apartment is very homey. It's very welcoming and quiet and close to a pharmacy, supermarket and laundromat. Your only a 15min walk to the path train into New York City.

Other things to note
There is no on the street parking available but if you wish to bring your car there is a pay parking lot available with $17 daily rates within a short distance from the apartment located at 2 Journal Square Plaza, Jersey City, NJ 07306
neighborhood_overview:
VIP diner is a 5 minute walk from apartment and is a classic American diner. There is a "Little India" 10 minutes from apartment with an entire subcontinent of Indian cuisine to sample. There are also halal restaurants in the area to enjoy.
The Journal Square shopping district is a nice clothes shopping area with affordable prices and a nice selection of styles.

name: Y. Small Den 10 mins away from World Trade Center
description:
Great location (Exchange Place area):
5 mins walk to Exchange Place station (1 stop away from World Trade Center)
8 mins walk to Grove Street (15 mins ride to Empire State)
5 mins walk to Hudson River for Manhattan skyline

Grove Street, the nightlife/restaurants area is a few blocks away! :) supermarket and convenient stores are within walking distance.

Check in and Check out time is flexible by request.

我们中文英文都可以说

The space
This is a DEN room converted to a guest room. It has a one twin bed, chair and bedside table. It is only good for one person.
It has no window and we have space heater for winter and fan for the summer. Our apartment has heater, so it wont be cold with the space heater.

We hire professional clean lady to keep our place as clean as possible.

You will share this apartment with us and other guest.This is the smaller room for max 1 guest. We have 2 full bathrooms(shower
neighborhood_overview:
Very safe area. We are surrounded by high rising buildings and nice restaurants. It is considered as the most safe area in Jersey city. we are also considered the best neighborhood in NYC in 2017 :)

I have lived in this neighborhood for 10 years and still deeply in love with it. I love hanging out in Manhattan, however, when I get back home, I want it to be quiet, safe and cozy. This is exactly how our neighborhood feels like. I like to walk to the waterfront to see the water and Manhattan skyline during Sunset time in a good day. (Do not miss it, it is worthy millions! :) . Our area is very quiet, yet, Walking 10 mins, you will get to the busy fun night life in Grove street area. Many new restaurants opened nearby. (we have 3 restaurant in 1 block!) and supermarket is within 10 mins walk too.

name: Hop, skip to NYC: Charming 2BD/2BA in Downtown JC
description:
Our home is your home! Welcome to our 2 bed/2 bath duplex (w/backyard!) in a historic brownstone, just 2 blocks from the Newport PATH & Light Rail in one direction and 2 blocks from beautiful Hamilton Park in the other.

You’ll have exclusive access to the first 2 floors of the space, with your own entrance on the ground floor. Inside you'll find modern amenities, exposed brick & cozy touches.

We’re a married couple and live in a separate unit upstairs, here to help however we can!

The space
*IMPORTANT NOTE*
The recent legislation (Nov. '19) passed to regulate Jersey City Airbnbs does not affect our listing, as we live in a separate unit in the same building. Rest assured that you will be in a compliant property should you choose to rent with us.

*THE LOCATION*
We are just about the closest you can be to Manhattan, on the Jersey side, which means a very fast commute to and from NYC. We're minutes from the Holland Tunn
neighborhood_overview:
We love living in the Newport/Hamilton Park neighborhood.

Hamilton Park boasts tennis courts, basketball courts, farmer's markets seasonally, and wonderful strolling paths.

Newport Mall features crowd-pleaser stores, like Macy's, Kohl's, H&M + Coach, restaurants including Panera, Cheesecake Factory and Pret a Manger, as well as an Avis + Hertz rental car companies.

Our local wine whop is Madame Claude - definitely worth a visit!!

Just a short walking distance, the Grove Street neighborhood has an eclectic, more local mix of smaller cafes, bars, shops and restaurants.

On the food front, some of our favorites include Talde (delish small plates!), O kafe (2 min. walk, great coffee + sandwiches), Taqueria (get the tacos!).

Fun, local shops we'd recommend are Kanibal & Co., Another Man's Treasure (vintage), Mint Market, and WORD bookstore.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: Hello! I'm a central Jersey native who spent the last 10 years living & working in NYC. My husband Nick and I just moved back across the river to Jersey City, where we're putting down roots and enjoying a tad less intensity than our Manhattan lives afforded. We enjoy food from all parts of the world, live music in small venues, and weekend adventures.  We've loved being Airbnb guests for years, and are excited to now play the role of host. We're really enjoying JC, and would love to help you fall in love with it, too.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are just a short 4-min walk to the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

The space

The Art House apartment community is home to both long-term residents and short-term guests. Professionally ho
neighborhood_overview:
The Art House is located in the heart of the Historic Powerhouse Arts District. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

neighborhood_overview:
The Heights area of Jersey City is a walkable, family-friendly getaway just outside of New York City with a neighborhood feel. Our home is located just a block away from Central Ave, The Heights "main street" which features shops, a diverse selection of incredible authentic restaurants (Indian, Thai, Peruvian, Columbian, Italian, Cuban, Mexican, Chinese, Japanese, American, Puerto Rican, and more!), grocery stores, bars, nail salons, barber shops, etc. Located just around the corner (and a personal favorite) is The Hutton, a cozy bar/restaurant with a warm atmosphere for cold nights and a large back patio ideal for warmer days. They have the best brunch around and offer unique twists on classic favorite dishes all day long. You also can't go wrong with a drink at their bar!

Just a half-mile walk east of our home is Riverview Park. This park is situated on the edge of The Palisades and offers views of the Manhattan Skyline (especially beautiful at sunset!). From May through

description:
Other things to note
Please read and comply with our House Rules.

1. We will not accept more than Two adult guest to a room.

Kitchen utensils are available to prepare your own meals if you wish to.

2. Please wash and clean dishes and put away any kitchen utensils after use.

3. Clean stove after use.

4. Absolutely No smoking in the house.

5. Absolutely No illegal drugs allowed.

6. Absolutely No unregistered guest allowed without prior approval in the house

7. No pets allowed.

8. Please lock front at all times.

9. Please turn of water when not in use.

10. Any significant damage will result in the loss of security deposit.

11. Flush toilet after use.

12. Please dispose sanitary napkins / paper towel in garbage bin.

13. Pleas take all your belongings with you when checking out.

Thank you so much

Jane

name: Heights Haven for NYC, safe from infections.
description:
Welcome to your haven from the pandemic in trendy Jersey City "Heights.” This contemporary 1 bedroom apartment with its own entrance from the outside without shared hallways or corridors to minimize infection risk, has all modern conveniences for your private use, including your own laundry inside the apartment. Rental cars are walking distance for trips to the countryside, and bus or train will take you to Manhattan in under 30 minutes. Wifi, Cable TV and Netflix are all included.

The space
The apartment's private entrance from the outside is 5 steps down from the house's gated front yard. It is the lower ground floor of the house that used to be the home of the most famous celebrity in the neighborhood, Richie Havens (see the photos in the living room in his honor). It has one private bedroom with a Queen bed, which has a study desk included. The sofa bed in the living room opens up to accommodate up to two people, if there are more than 2 of you. There is a
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City Heights is  the least densely populated neighborhood of Jersey City, with most housing being 2-story houses not high rise apartments, making it less risky for infections. It has been billed as "The Williamsburg of New Jersey" meaning this is a diverse and trendy neighborhood with a thriving art and alternative scene. Hipsters like good cuisine, and highlights here are, for adventurous carnivores, Dark Side of the Moo (ever tried Yak burgers or alligator sausage?),  Choc'o' Pain for French visitor-approved pastries, Bread and Salt for gourmet pizza, The Corkscrew bar on the corner of our block, which is renowned for its food as well as its drinks, as is The Fox and The Crow a couple of blocks away, and Lo-Fi and The Hutton a bit further down. These places are now doing take out. Check them out on Yelp.  Other highlights include international options, especially from South America and Asia, organic ice cream,  and a community garden where you can pick fresh vegetables and her

name: Convenient & Modern plus Amenities | ACE LOCATION
description:
Welcome to the heart of Jersey City’s Historic Powerhouse Arts District! Stay in our comfy, convenient, luxurious 1BD/1BA residence in The Art House.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are just a short 4-min walk to the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

Plus, we’re just 11 miles from Newark International Airport, making The Art House the perfect choice for families and business travelers alike! *Limited Parking*

The space
Bright, spacious & beautifully designed, our fully-equipped 1BR/1BA residence is perfect for relaxing vaca or focused business travel, or both! There is a QUEEN SIZE bed in the master and a sleeper sofa in the living area, accommodating up to 4 guests. Your stay conveniently includes travel-sized soaps, shampoo & conditioner.

The Art House apartment community is home to both long-term residents and short-term guests. Professionally ho
neighborhood_overview:
The Art House is located in the heart of the Historic Powerhouse Arts District. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

description:
**Stay with peace of mind - all of our rentals are cleaned before and after each stay by a professional cleaning agency trained in proper disinfection techniques. All our rentals also feature digital locks for easy self check-in**

20 minutes by car to NYC. Situated in a quiet, residential neighborhood, this is the perfect place for your family or group to relax after a long day exploring NYC or Jersey City. There is even a Foosball table for your enjoyment and there's parking for 1 car for your convenience.

- 24/7 guest support via message, email, or phone
- Professionally cleaned
- Self check-in

To abide by all legal requirements and HOA rules, you WILL asked to provide a copy of your official government-issued photo ID, confirm your contact information, pass through our verification portal and, in some instances, complete a criminal background check. Failure to provide these documents will result in a cancellation and denied entry.
neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

Spacious apartment perfect for your stay! The offered space is great for long or short stays, with all the amenities and comforts of home. host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Our home is blessed with 5 generations.
Our home was built in the early 1900's and purchased in 1957 by my grandfather for $7,000. Today, our family still lives here with so many great memories.
It's a 2 family house and we've established a very warm and wonderful experience welcoming outstanding guests to enjoy our first floor apartment with a sense of heritage and pride.
Most Sincerely,
Patricia and family

name: The Brick Studio only 30 Mins to NYC
description:
Authentic Jersey City Heights basement studio. The house that sits on top is a classic Jersey City row-house. The walls and columns in the basement were carefully refinished to recreate the original brick work.

* Please note the ceilings is relatively low and would best suit guests under 6 feet tall.

* There is no oven or kitchen sink. Best for guests who do not plan to cook in the space.

* Thirty - forty minutes away from Midtown New York City via bus or train. Come take a break.

The space
The studio is thoughtfully designed for maximum guest comfort in their home away from home. Guests may enjoy Keurig, toaster, and microwave for quick meal prep. There is a dining table, sitting area with coffee table, daybed sofa, smart tv with cable, and bathroom with shower, and of course WIFI! Room comfortably sleeps four: there is one queen size bed, one twin size bed, and one large twin size daybed.

Please note there is no ov
neighborhood_overview:
Two blocks away from Central Ave. This is a street full of cheap shopping, restaurants, coffee shops all along the sidewalk. You also will catch the bus to Port Authority in NYC here.

There is also Riverview Park park located four blocks away on 498 Palisade Ave. If you want to go for a scenic walk definitely include this! There a farmers market at Riverview Park which is held every Sunday (rain or shine) from the first Sunday in May through the Sunday before Thanksgiving in November, from 10 am to 3 pm.

name: Spacious&Sunny 1Bdrm Apt, 1 block to GroveSt. Path
description:
Spacious & sunny, 1 bedroom apartment located just 1 block from Grove St. Station. Catch 5 min NJ Path train to Downtown Manhattan. Very clean, fully equipped with tons of charm. Perfectly located in the heart of downtown Jersey City! Tons of restaurants, bars, and shops everywhere. Laundromat directly across the street! Perfect location for enjoying NYC and NJ. Tons of sunlight and windows.

The space
Comfortably sleeps two couples or 4 people who don't mind sharing a beds. Full kitchen, wifi, and tons of records for your listening pleasure. There's also a charming little nook which can double as luggage storage or a small office space.
neighborhood_overview: Literally, located right in the heart of booming, downtown Jersey City! Quickly becoming the new Brooklyn.  There are too many restaurants, bars, shops, markets, etc. to name.  Literally everything you might need during your stay is within a 3 block radius.  Best of all, you are 1 block away from the Grove St. Path Station that is a 5 min train ride into downtown Manhattan.  Laundry is directly across the street.

description:
Best Value for visiting NYC! Short Uber ride (around $7) or 25 minutes walking(1.3miles/2kms) to Journal Square Path Station, which will bring you to Manhattan in 15 minutes!
Extra large 3 bedroom 3 bathroom duplex apartment which sleeps 8 people comfortably with full kitchen. Professionally cleaned after each stay.
Apartment is directly facing 270-acre Lincoln Park, which is the oldest and largest in Hudson County.
Easy access to highway. Plenty of street parking.

The apartment is located on the second and third floor of a multi-unit building.

The apartment has 3 bedrooms 3 bathrooms fully furnished. One bedroom on the lower level has a queen size bed and a full master bathroom. Two bedrooms on the upper level, one has a queen size bed and the other has a full size bed. There is a small shared hall bathroom on the upper level. Each bedroom features 12 inch memory foam mattress and premium bedding. The living room has a futon

name: Gorgeous studio, full kitchen near NYC Manhattan!
description:
Fully furnished studio apartment close to public transportation into Manhattan. Buses on block and Journal Square is a 15 minute walk. New Via app provides $1-$2 rides in town. Supermarket and deli on quiet block. SmartCast tv, WiFi and Keureg. Exposed brick, quiet apartment. Full kitchen includes pots, pans, glasses and utensils. Everything you need for a short getaway or close enough for sightseeing and exploring Manhattan. Downtown Jersey City and liberty state park are also minutes away.

The space
Full kitchen with appliances. You can stay in and eat or explore the restaurants in the area. 4K tv with WiFi also available. Full bathroom with shower and tub. Queen size pull out bed for comfortable sleeping. Getaway in the city or just take a breather from your everyday in this historic home with exposed brick and character.

Guest access
Front patio area and studio apartment
neighborhood_overview: Easy commute into New York City. Deli and supermarket in walking distance. Quiet tree lined street of row houses built in 1898. New Via app provides $1-$2 rides in town.

Right at the corner on Palisade Avenue are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

name: Luxurious Studio mins from NYC
description:
Welcome to the heart of Jersey City’s Historic Powerhouse Arts District! Stay in our comfy, convenient, luxurious Studio residence in The Art House.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are just a short 4-min walk to the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

Plus, we’re just 11 miles from Newark International Airport, making The Art House the perfect choice for families and business travelers alike! *Limited Parking*

The space
Bright, spacious & beautifully designed, our fully-equipped Studio residence is perfect for relaxing vaca or focused business travel, or both! There is a QUEEN SIZE bed in the living area. Your stay conveniently includes travel-sized soaps, shampoo & conditioner.

The Art House apartment community is home to both long-term residents and short-term guests. Professionally hosted, Guesthouse by DVORA extends a variety of luxury amenities t
neighborhood_overview:
The Art House is located in the heart of the Historic Powerhouse Arts District. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

description:
Smart opportunity for guests who want to visit NYC without paying the overwhelming City prices. Great choice for visitors, vacation tourists, business travelers or students.
Fascinating location in Jersey City with short walk to train station: 15 minute subway commute into Manhattan, 10min ride to World Trade Center and 10min to Newark Int'Airport. Also cheap Uber/Lyft rides.

The space
Brand new furniture. This bedroom has a queen size bed - like sleeping on a cloud. It is very spacious, has a desk and chair if you need to work or organize your stuff. Closet dresser with drawers. It's right off the living room and has 2 wide sunny windows and private bathroom.

Bedroom has its own closet with safety lock and a lot of space to store luggage and organize your personal belongings.


SECURITY
A 24/7 re
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very quiet and safe. A melting pot of different ethnicities and cultural backgrounds. Beautifully diverse but mainly professionals and full-time workers living in a family community. The courthouse building is across the street with full security 24/7
Security cameras on premises 24/7. Never had any issue or safety situation in the past 10 years that I've lived here. I really love and appreciate our growing community.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I am a 33 year old man. I am self-employed, working in building my own business online as I do part time in hospitality and go to school in NYC. I go to my house, two or three times a week sometimes more to clean or get creative in the basement as I enjoy painting and gardening.
I  make sure the house is clean and always looks presentable. I have great neighborhood and my house is super comfy and quiet. I would love to host you and make sure you have an enjoyable comfortable and most importantly clean stay. Ask me any question you may have in mind. I love helping by providing the best recommendations around the city, best restaurants and things to do in the area.
I am pretty laid back, I enjoy running (and cooking), gardening, socializing, traveling. I also like to keep a very clean house and respect the environment.

NB: Price discount 10% OFF for staying weekly, 14night or monthly. Looking forward welcoming you :)

Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

name: Historic Single Family Home near Metro, 2 Bedrooms
description:
100 year old charming home on a quiet residential street!

Rent this private and cozy space while gearing up for your next family cruise, trip into New York City, epic sports event or your international flight out of Newark Airport! P.S. Talk to us about leaving your vehicle in our secure driveway during your cruise or trip.

The space
This three story naturally well-lit home is situated on a quiet residential street up the block from the light rail. The bedrooms boast comfortable full and queen size beds with high quality sheets and hypoallergenic pillows. The rooms are equipped with a mini fridge, tea kettle, coffee pot, snacks and tea table, perfect for a solo traveler, couple, or family of 4. The bathroom, immediately adjacent to bedroom 2, is fully stocked with organic toiletries and fresh towels. Wi-Fi is also included. The driveway is available for parking. Talk to us about leaving your vehicle for an extended time while you are on your cruise!
neighborhood_overview:
What we love about our city is its accessibility and prime location. On either corner of this residential street, you can walk to an authentic pizzeria or ice cream shop. A little closer to midtown you can feast at Cibao for lunch or uptown at Cafe Talya for Mediterranean brekkie. Don't forget to visit the idyllic Magic Fountain or scrumptious Judicke's bakery!

Also within walking distance, two short blocks, to the lightrail that can take you to Liberty State Park (Statue of Liberty), Hoboken (Cake Boss Bakery) or New York City! You are a 5 minute drive to the Walmart, international cruise port; a 15 minute drive to Newark International Airport, Ikea, the Mills at Jersey Gardens Mall, and a 20 minute drive into Lower Manhattan.
host_location: Bayonne, New Jersey, United States
host_about: We have been married 30 years, have raised 2 kids, owned a business and lived the American dream! (Not without its challenges, but worth it!) We are easy going and love meeting new people.  We love to travel and know how important it is to feel at home when away from home.

host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I am young, 'trendy' (try to be) professional living in New York.  I moved to NY one year ago from London, although I'm originally from Australia. 

My style of Airbnb-hosting is to provide an extremely high standard - the best service and 'space' that I can, so that my guests enjoy themselves to the fullest.  Over the last few years I have had the pleasure of staying in many Airbnb places all around the world; and I have had wonderful experiences.  Now I want to return the favor, I want you to feel like you are in a 5 Star Hotel.   

Briefly about my career... Two years ago I moved out of the 'Start-up field' to start my own business in Real Estate, and haven't looked back since.  

My motto in life is cliche but true: You can get anything you want in your life as long as you put your heart and mind into it, whilst at the same time having a strong sense of integrity.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is located in a residential/ urban area of Jersey City, known as Bergen Lafayette. This apartment is nestled on a hill, whereby you can see Manhattan and is very close to public transportation, 'the light-rail', making it a great place to stay if you want to explore Manhattan. neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a beautiful, growing artist community right above Hoboken. This luxury condo is located right in the formal Riverview Arts District and has numerous coffee places, cafes, restaurants, juice bars, and dessert places opening regularly.

Right at the corner on JFK Blvd, are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

Walk a few blocks down on Congress Street and there is the 9th Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. Right at the corner on JFK Blvd, are regular private buses into Port Authority, New York City. These buses take about 15-20 minutes, come every few minutes, and are about $3 per person.

Also right at the corner is NJ Transit Buses which goes to Port Authority for $4.50, but you must have exact change.

NJ Transit App can be downloaded for routes and fares as well as CityMapper app.

Walk a few blocks down on Congress Street and there is the 9th Street Light Rail Station in Hoboken, you can take the rail to the path or ferry and get to Downtown or Midtown Manhattan. name: Vintage Victorian Row House - min to NYC!
description:
Vintage Victorian row house full of charm and character. Close to NYC, with views, great parks, excellent coffee, cute cafe's, restaurants and culture. The quiet city life.

The space
You will find lots of books, vinyl and art in our home to keep you entertained. You can also enjoy hanging out on the front porch or relaxing in the backyard hammock. Kids are welcome and there are plenty of toys and games to play with.

We have a brand new fully equipped kitchen and brand new full bathroom. Plenty of closet space, washer and dryer and brand new organic mattresses!

Other things to note
Younger children are welcome, but be aware there is a lot of glass and vintage/antique objects, as well as stairs. We raised our daughter in the home however there could be hazards for little ones.
neighborhood_overview: We have some real gems within a few blocks from the house!  You will find a full list upon arrival but here are some of our favorites: Freshly roasted coffee at Modcup coffee Co., Organic grab and go meals from Busy Bee Organics, enjoy a delicious brunch at The Cliff and be sure to sit outside under their umbrella skies, grab a drink in the speakeasy at Fox & Crow, Great Italian food from Corto,  Dark side of the Moo for exotic burgers and meat, Specialty and organic wines from Riverview Wines,  Sweet treats from the always popular Dulce De Leche and organic ice cream at Milk Sugar Love, and the Riverview Park (Farmers market every Sunday during the warmer months) which has an incredible panoramic view of the NYC skyline.  We are also accessible to many public transport options to NYC and walking distance to Hoboken.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about: We (family of 3,  husband, daughter and self) love vintage, travel, culture, music, food, health, animals, nature and exploring new places.

description:
Stay in the heart of Downtown Jersey City in our luxurious private residence. Our 2BR/2BA is ultra-comfortable, fully-equipped and ideally located next to Newark Ave.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are located across from the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

Plus, we’re just 11 miles from Newark International Airport, making The Grove a perfect choice for families and business travelers alike! *Limited Parking*

The space
Bright, spacious & beautifully designed, our 2BR/2BA residence is perfect for relaxing vaca or focused business travel, or both! There is a QUEEN SIZE bed in the master & a bunkbed in the second bedroom and a sleeper sofa in the living area, accommodating up to 6 guests. Your stay conveniently includes travel-sized soaps, shampoo & conditioner.

The Grove is a short-term apartment community, accommodating guests looking for conveni
neighborhood_overview:
The Grove is located in the heart of Downtown Jersey City. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Porta, South House, Ibby's Falafel, Wonder Bagels, Wurstbar, Micro-Brewery, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts when the light is on! So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

name: The Alana - A Chic Duplex 40 Minutes from NYC
description:
Welcome to The Alana, a newly renovated flat in the bustling Bergen Lafayette section of Jersey City. Filled with natural light, this tastefully furnished space features two floors, 4 bedrooms / 2 baths, a fully equipped kitchen, and in-unit washer and dryer. Travel to Manhattan via PATH trains, reachable by Uber or via the Light Rail two blocks away - total trip time will be 30-40 minutes.

Monthly renters welome.

The space
The Alana is a duplex apartment located on the second floor of a two family charming row house in the heart of Jersey City. Groups and families will be comfortable here with enough beds for seven people and two full bathrooms featuring luxurious walk-in showers. All necessities will be provided - towels, bedding, upscale toiletries, hair dryers, iron / board, first aid kit, and more. Check in is a breeze with secure electronic locks. We are always reachable in case you have any questions or requests. Please note the house is equ
neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

description:
Smart opportunity for guests who want to visit NYC without paying the overwhelming City prices. Great choice for visitors, vacation tourists, business travelers or students.
Fascinating location in Jersey City with short walk to train station: 15 minute Subway commute into Manhattan, 10min ride to World Trade Center and 10min to Newark Int'Airport. Also cheap Uber/Lyft rides.
Driving? Precisely 5-10min drive to NYC via Holland Tunnel (normal traffic)+Free street parking.
Check profile reviews!

The space
Brand new furniture. This bedroom has a queen size bed - like sleeping on a cloud. It is very spacious, has a desk and chair if you need to work or organize your stuff. Large clothes closet with drawers.
It's right off the living room and has a sunny window and shared full bathroom.

Bedroom has its own closet with safety lock and a lot of space to store luggage and organize your personal belongings.

Strategic location
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very quiet and safe. A melting pot of different ethnicities and cultural backgrounds. Beautifully diverse but mainly professionals and full-time workers living in a family community. The courthouse building is across the street with full security 24/7
Security cameras on premises 24/7. Never had any issue or safety situation in the past 10 years that I've lived here. I really love and appreciate our growing community.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I am a 33 year old man. I am self-employed, working in building my own business online as I do part time in hospitality and go to school in NYC. I go to my house, two or three times a week sometimes more to clean or get creative in the basement as I enjoy painting and gardening.
I  make sure the house is clean and always looks presentable. I have great neighborhood and my house is super comfy and quiet. I would love to host you and make sure you have an enjoyable comfortable and most importantly clean stay. Ask me any question you may have in mind. I love helping by providing the best recommendations around the city, best restaurants and things to do in the area.
I am pretty laid back, I enjoy running (and cooking), gardening, socializing, traveling. I also like to keep a very clean house and respect the environment.

NB: Price discount 10% OFF for staying weekly, 14night or monthly. Looking forward welcoming you :)

name: Jersey city: Small Room with shared bathroom
description: Tiny room to sleep and shower.  Shared bathroom.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hello, 

Foremost, thanks for taking the time out to review my listings and learn more about me.

My name is Nassly.  I have lived in NJ most of my life.   I love traveling, especially on a budget and understand the importance of having a safe and clean space to lay one's head.

I have been a host and a guest. 

As a host, I am opening my own home to  provide clean, comfortable, and budget friendly rooms in a HUMBLE home-like atmosphere.   Staying with us, is like staying at a distant family member's home.  I take pride and put much effort (elbow grease) in cleaning, maintaining, and SLOWLY upgrading my listings.  I do NOT provide luxury hotel accommodations.  If that is what you are seeking, please book at the Ritz & pay hotel prices to do so.  I do not have professional staff or offer butler service.  My home, like most bodies, has stretch marks, creaks, and minor dents.  It also has wear and tear from hosting and age. 

I am extremely honest in my listing descriptions. Please read them.

As a traveler, I have visited and backpacked through many different countries on a shoestring.  My experiences have been awesome.  

My goal is to enable others to be able to do the same. 

 Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns during your stay or prior to.   

*******Please Note******************

For safety of my guests, my home, and myself, I provide full disclosure of myself and expect same from my guests.  

I require an accurate and clear profile picture & completed registration on  Airbnb profile, including uploading your government ID prior to check-in.  If not, your reservation will not be accepted or you will be cancelled.  Thank you for your understanding.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the former immigrant gateway. The park’s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtown’s Grove Street.

description:
Clean, quiet and safe room in the fantastic neighborhood of Jersey City Heights. Quick 30 minute bus ride to Time Square, easily accessible from the apartment. neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. There are frequent buses to Times Square just a short walk away from the apartment. Buses run every 10 minutes. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby with diverse and delicious cuisine.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to university in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. 

I work freelance in tech, and in my spare time I enjoy walking in the park by my apartment, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My boyfriend Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in NYC.

Private and cozy 1 bedroom apartment just minutes from the greatest city in the world.

Want to visit NYC but don't want to be in the loud hustle and bustle of the big city? Why not stay in Jersey City? A single train stop away from the World Trade Center, you can zoom to any popular tourist destinations in minutes!

I also have Amazon Alexa so you can ask her to turn on the lights for you or play some music!

name: McGinley Square Cabin (Holiday Special)
description:
Downtown Jersey City isn't the only cool area in Jersey City. McGinley Square is a very trendy area now, we have lots of new development here as well as great dining options.

The home is right at the center of it all. This beautiful one bedroom has a view of the World Trade Center from the kitchen window.

Imagine waking up and having a cup of coffee with your breakfast and being able to city New York. If you need a comfortable place to crash and take a refreshing shower, its right here.

The space
YOU CAN SEE THE FREEDOM TOWER CLEARLY OUT OF THE KITCHEN WINDOW!

Spacious for a couple, perfect for a small family. We keep this home very simple and lightly furnished. We don't want you bumping into everything as you pass. We are like New York but you get more bang for your buck.

We keep this home fully stocked with all the essentials. This actually was my apartment until i moved in with my girlfriend. That is how i can ass
neighborhood_overview:
McGinley Square is a 10 min walk to Journal Square. There you can get 2 trains that get you to NYC in 10 mins flat!

We have some cool dining options. Carvao BBQ is great, Crema is a cool coffee shop with ice cream, ohlala! is a french eatery, and El Cocotero is an amazing Venezuelan dining experience!
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
I am a young entrepreneur, I manage properties and vehicles by day, I go to school at night. I work hard in everything I do, I think im an extremely helpful individual. I was naturally born to provide hospitality/customer service/sales, at least that's how I feel! 

I am currently pursuing a degree in Hospitality, Management, & Entrepreneurship, graduation 2018. It is my life's pursuit to make the everyone's day a little brighter. I love to travel, meet new people, and just live. My favorite thing to do is, learn about the cultures of others where I visit,  and those who visit me.

My long term goal is to acquire international properties and luxury SUVs to manage & rent them. I actually embarked on hosting a condo in the always beautiful, Dominican Republic. 

I am moving one step at a time, one reservation at a time. I have been on this journey since September 2015 .Each guest that stays with me or rents one of my vehicles helps me get closer to my dreams. 

I sincerely appreciate anyone who decides to reserve one of my homes. 

I hope your stay is a dream come true too!

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are located across from the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

The space

neighborhood_overview:
The Grove is located in the heart of Downtown Jersey City. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Porta, South House, Ibby's Falafel, Wonder Bagels, Wurstbar, Micro-Brewery, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts when the light is on! So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the former immigrant gateway. The park’s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtown’s Grove Street.

World-class art murals adorn the buildings - mural-spotting makes for a great little activity whilst exploring Jersey City. neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

Super transportation-friendly, it's a few blocks to the Grove Street PATH train (runs all night) and a 5 minute ride to NYC. Easy access to all NYC offers, or stay local and enjoy downtown Jersey City.

The space

neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. There are frequent buses to Times Square just a short walk away from the apartment. Buses run every 10 minutes. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby with diverse and delicious cuisine.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to university in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. 

I work freelance in tech, and in my spare time I enjoy walking in the park by my apartment, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My boyfriend Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in NYC.

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

host_location: Israel
host_about:
The Local Stay, founded in 2008 to make the process of renting furnished short- and long-term apartments absolutely transparent, so renters and property owners alike can rest easy.
At The Local Stay, our goal is to take the guess work out of it, carefully curating apartments so that travelers experience the true pulse of the city. And, since each property owner is personally vetted by The Local Stay team, travelers can rest assured that their stays will be safe and secure. Better vetting means that travelers get the most exclusive apartments in the most central locations, while greater involvement by The Local Stay means that property owners can list it and leave it as we handle communication with renters.
Today, The Local Stay offers hundreds of short-term and long-term rental properties in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, New-Jersey, Paris, Rome, Tel Aviv and more.... Our apartments inventory includes both corporate apartments and privately owned flats, making The Local Stay the perfect option for business travelers, corporate relocation clients and those on sabbatical, as well as foreign students and families on holiday. With options for everyone, The Local Stay provides personalized service so that every traveler can stay like a local.

description:
Soaring 50 stories above the Hudson River, this glamorous tower has everything a traveler would need (and more!) for a trip to the NYC metro. Enjoy all the bells and whistles, including:

Walkable neighborhood a block from Newport Centre

The space
At Global Luxury Suites, your wellbeing is our top priority, therefore, we are following the CDC guidelines to ensure your safety. All apartments are thoroughly cleaned after each resident has checked out and before another guest checks in. All linens are changed and surfaces are sanitized (handles, windows, appliances, countertops, furniture, etc.). In addition, our teams will be fully sanitizing common areas such as business centers and recreation rooms for guests’ safety.<

neighborhood_overview: Known affectionately as the "sixth borough," Jersey City is staking its claim as a destination in its own right within the New York City metropolitan area. Young professionals, artists and families have flocked to the Jersey side of the Hudson in recent years and have created a city that is both an extension of Manhattan and a place where you can see and feel an authentic Jersey vibe. Visitors to New York City will find that Jersey City not only offers more reasonably-priced accommodations with easy access to the Big Apple, but also noteworthy parks, restaurants, bars and other attractions that will make for a fun and memorable trip.

host_location: Israel
host_about:
The Local Stay, founded in 2008 to make the process of renting furnished short- and long-term apartments absolutely transparent, so renters and property owners alike can rest easy.
At The Local Stay, our goal is to take the guess work out of it, carefully curating apartments so that travelers experience the true pulse of the city. And, since each property owner is personally vetted by The Local Stay team, travelers can rest assured that their stays will be safe and secure. Better vetting means that travelers get the most exclusive apartments in the most central locations, while greater involvement by The Local Stay means that property owners can list it and leave it as we handle communication with renters.
Today, The Local Stay offers hundreds of short-term and long-term rental properties in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, New-Jersey, Paris, Rome, Tel Aviv and more.... Our apartments inventory includes both corporate apartments and privately owned flats, making The Local Stay the perfect option for business travelers, corporate relocation clients and those on sabbatical, as well as foreign students and families on holiday. With options for everyone, The Local Stay provides personalized service so that every traveler can stay like a local.

name: Mins to NYC, Gorgeous Downtown Apartment
description:
Welcome to the heart of Jersey City’s Historic Powerhouse Arts District! Stay in our comfy, convenient, luxurious 1BD/1BA residence in The Art House.

Jersey City offers some the best East Coast eateries, bars, shops & entertainment! You are just a short 4-min walk to the PATH train station taking you directly into NYC or Hoboken.

Plus, we’re just 11 miles from Newark International Airport, making The Art House the perfect choice for families and business travelers alike! *Limited Parking*

The space
Bright, spacious & beautifully designed, our 1BR/1BA residence is perfect for relaxing vaca or focused business travel, or both! There is a QUEEN SIZE bed in the master and a sleeper sofa in the living area, accommodating up to 4 guests. Your stay conveniently includes travel-sized soaps, shampoo & conditioner.

The Art House apartment community is home to both long-term residents and short-term guests. Professionally hosted, Guesthous
neighborhood_overview:
The Art House is located in the heart of the Historic Powerhouse Arts District. Vibrant, energetic and so many options for getting brunch, lunch, dinner, coffee, going out, working out and more. Hidden Grounds Cafe, Gelato, Micro-Brewery, Kickboxing, HIIT, Yoga, Pilates all next door. *Noise Note: You are located in the center of a bustling city, so you can expect city noises.*

Nearby Newark Ave is a dedicated pedestrian area that features many local restaurants, bars, and boutique shops. Pick up fresh Krispy Cream donuts on your walk to the PATH. So much to explore & enjoy! Extremely walkable, excellent public transit options including Citi Bikes.

*Parking Note: Metered Street Parking is available, but the street is busy and often full. Check for street sweeping signs to know when to move your vehicle. Paid lots and garages are available in the nearby area.*

Check out the local arts, music & events scene!

Here are a few of our favorites:

name: Newly renovated apartment - 10 minutes to NYC
description:
Modern and minimalist apartment, completely renovated in 2019. Sleeps 4: two twin beds in the common area, queen bed in the separate bedroom. Plenty of closet space. European-style bathroom. Kitchenette (with goodies for breakfast and late-night snacks), dining set for 4, workspace (high speed internet), and smart TV in the common area. 10 minute walk to the Path (subway) station; 2 stops to Manhattan.

The space
The motto of the apartment is: Everything guests need, and nothing they don't. Based on the owners extensive travel experiences, guests need a clean, comfortable place that combines convenience with practicality. What they don't need is having their surroundings cluttered with the owner's personal belongings and/or items that they are unlikely to use during their stay. Hence, the apartment strives to prove that 'simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.'
neighborhood_overview: Located in Historic Downtown Jersey City, a 5-minute walk gets you to lots of restaurants and bars, deli, mini market, supermarket with huge organic selection, liquor store, laundromat,  Hamilton park (children's playgrounds, tennis and basketball courts), Newport Mall. You will find a more detailed description (exact location, opening hours) in the apartment.
host_location: Jersey City, New Jersey, United States
host_about:
Visiting NYC? Stay at Sonja's AirBnB!
I fell in love with New York City even before I visited it for the first time as a teenager. Having lived in its close proximity for a quarter century, I can attest that "there is nothing you can't do," and that its "streets will make you feel brand new." I am grateful and excited to play a part in your New York experience by welcoming you to my apartment in Jersey City's Historic Downtown, just a 10-minute walk and 2-stop subway ride away from "the city that never sleeps."

The Local Stay, founded in 2008 to make the process of renting furnished short- and long-term apartments absolutely transparent, so renters and property owners alike can rest easy.
At The Local Stay, our goal is to take the guess work out of it, carefully curating apartments so that travelers experience the true pulse of the city. And, since each property owner is personally vetted by The Local Stay team, travelers can rest assured that their stays will be safe and secure. Better vetting means that travelers get the most exclusive apartments in the most central locations, while greater involvement by The Local Stay means that property owners can list it and leave it as we handle communication with renters.
Today, The Local Stay offers hundreds of short-term and long-term rental properties in Amsterdam, Barcelona, Buenos Aires, London, New York, New-Jersey, Paris, Rome, Tel Aviv and more.... Our apartments inventory includes both corporate apartments and privately owned flats, making The Local Stay the perfect option for business travelers, corporate relocation clients and those on sabbatical, as well as foreign students and families on holiday. name: Park Views - Private 4 bed/2 bath - 30 mins to NYC
description:
My place is steps away from Lincoln Park and Saint Peter's University. You’ll love it because of the views, the coziness, the high ceilings, and the location. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids) and big groups.

Uber/Lyft pickup within 5 minutes or less, Citi bike rental nearby, Fastest public transportation route to NYC takes 30 minutes. TV and Wi-Fi.

Professionally cleaned after each stay.

The space
4 Bedrooms, Cozy Living Room with large bay windows, Dining Room, Kitchen w/ Park Views and full Bathroom.

The apartment is kept immaculate and is cleaned after every guest. Fresh bedding and towels provided. Steps away from Lincoln Park where there is a Farmers Market every Sunday, Running/Walking Nature trail, and also a bike lane throughout the park. You can park on the street or overnight free parking in Lincoln Park.
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located on the edge of Beautiful Lincoln Park. A very large place where you can enjoy a variety of leisure actives, from a morning jog or scenic walk to tennis, golf, cycling, basketball, baseball, football, soccer, picnicking, sunbathing, fishing (in the Hackensack River), bird watching, kayaking or even Pokemon Go!

The West Side neighborhood, north of Lincoln Park, is a quiet residential district with small to medium shops on West Side Avenue, Duncan Avenue and Communipaw. These avenues contain delis (bodegas), supermarkets, convenience stores, laundromats, pizzerias, Asian fast food, Mcdonald's churches, pharmacies, bars, liquor stores, nail salon, and beauty parlors.

Directly south of Lincoln Park, immediately west of Route 440 is Hudson Mall, which hosts large outlets like Old Navy, Staples, Chuck e Cheese, Marshall's, ToysRus, Gamestop, Big Lots, Lowes, Foot Locker, Pep Boys, Applebee's, Pizza Hunt, Popeyes, Taco bell, Hibachi Grill Buffet and

description:
Private room with double bed and sink in the room located in our Century old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated.

We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.
neighborhood_overview:
We are a Century’s old Guest/Rooming House that has been renovated. We offer European style rooms with shared bathrooms and Continental styled rooms with private bathrooms.
All rooms have microwave ovens, mini refrigerators, desk and chair, Iron, blow dryer, heat and air conditioning (in the summer and spring), sheets, comforter, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, plastic utensils, plates, bowls, cups, toilet paper and free Wi-Fi.
We also have a laundry room for your use (for a fee) on premises and we will provide you with a refillable laundry card.

The property is clean, safe and secure and is located in a quiet tree-lined residential neighborhood only one block from 24 hour Journal Square ( JSQ) PATH train station. In the PATH station there is a 24 hour Deli/Café and several Deli, coffee shops and stores within walking distance as well as the local police station.

Gorgeous, light-filled room with a big walk-in closet for one person. Big bedroom in a shared apartment with 4 other young, clean, professionals. In the fantastic neighborhood of Jersey City Heights. The bus is half a block away. Also cheap Uber ride to Hoboken, with direct PATH train to the city. Bathrooms are very clean, and WIFI is available throughout. The apartment is equipped with a central heating/cooling system.

The space
The apartment is huge and has 5 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. The room has a big closet, and a nice desk for working.
Comfortable full-size bed with bedding and towels available. All bills are included in the price.
Move-in and you're at home. It's that easy! Laundry machine and dishwasher available for your use.

Guest access
You will have sole access to your bedroom. The rest of the apartment is shared. Only one tenant in the other rooms.

Other things to note
